fullText: A union is about working people having each other’s backs, making sure you get the pay and benefits you deserve. That’s how we rebuild the middle class. Employers aren’t supposed to undermine that. The PRO Act will make sure your right to join one is protected. Pass it.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: MAGA Republicans in Congress say they want to cut the deficit, but their plans would add $3 trillion to it. So, how will they make the numbers add up? What will they cut?. For millions of Americans, health care hangs in the balance.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: A quarter of our national debt – which took 200 years to accumulate – was added by my predecessor. How did Congress respond?  . They voted three times to keep paying America’s bills without preconditions or crisis. They paid America’s bills then, why won’t they now?.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: The PACT Act is the most significant law in our nation’s history to help millions of toxic-exposed veterans, and their families, caregivers, and survivors who join them in their sacrifice. We got it done.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: My Administration’s Investing in America agenda is bringing a whole-of-government approach to disaster prevention and recovery as we enter hurricane season and prepare for summer wildfires.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: We'll never be able to repay the debt we owe to those who have worn the uniform, but this Administration won’t stop fighting to deliver timely access to the benefits and services they’ve earned.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: I made clear from the start of negotiations that the only path forward was a bipartisan budget agreement. No one got everything they wanted. But that’s the responsibility of governing. Now, the United States House and Senate must send this bill to my desk.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: We learned today that inflation over the last three months averaged 2.1%, the lowest level since before I took office. Families are still feeling the pinch, and there's more work to do. But these are signs our economic agenda is delivering.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: The United States and Costa Rica are not only united by the challenges we face – we’re united by the vision we share. A vision for a future of greater opportunity, freedom, equality, and dignity for all of our people.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: Every single American has a right to clean drinking water. Today, we're closer to guaranteeing that right. My Administration just announced a proposal to strengthen our Lead and Copper Rule, requiring water systems to replace lead service lines within 10 years.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: The United States is committed to addressing the critical humanitarian needs of Palestinian people in Gaza. And we will continue to work to sustain and expand the international response and rally the world to urgently increase support.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: I spoke today with Allies and partners to discuss Russia’s unprovoked war on Ukraine. We are continuing our support for the Ukrainian people as they defend their country and affirmed our readiness to keep imposing severe costs on Russia if they do not de-escalate.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: Judge Jackson is a nominee worthy of Justice Breyer’s legacy of excellence and decency. She’s eminently qualified and a brilliant legal mind — with the utmost character and integrity.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: For too long, our government and our courts haven’t looked like America. I believe it’s time that we have a Court that reflects the full talents and the greatness of our nation, with a nominee of extraordinary qualifications — Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: Judge Jackson is the daughter of former public school teachers, a proven consensus builder, an accomplished lawyer, and a distinguished jurist. I was proud to make this call.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: To every Gold Star Family — to every survivor — this grateful nation owes you. We can never repay your sacrifice, but we will never stop trying. And we will never fail in our duty to remember.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: The most important thing we can do now to transition from rapid recovery to stable, steady growth is to bring inflation down. That is why I have made tackling inflation my top economic priority. My plan has three parts — read more about them here:

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: The economy grew at a 2.6% rate last quarter while inflation started to slow. We know it will take time to get inflation back to normal levels as we keep our job market resilient. But our approach to building the economy of the future is working.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: The more people that get vaccinated, the faster we will beat this pandemic. That’s why one of my first goals is to administer 100 million COVID-19 vaccine shots in our first 100 days. I’m proud to say we’re over halfway to our goal and weeks ahead of schedule.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: Thank you to @SpeakerPelosi for your leadership and everyone in the House who supported the American Rescue Plan. Now, the bill heads to the Senate and there’s no time to waste. If we act quickly and decisively, we can finally get ahead of this virus and get our economy moving.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: Tune in as we honor our fallen heroes at the 153rd National Memorial Day Observance.

fullText: Last night in Kabul, the United States ended 20 years of war in Afghanistan. The longest war in our history. We completed one of the biggest airlifts in history — with more than 120,000 people evacuated to safety. No nation has ever done anything like it.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: The past 17 days have seen our troops execute the largest airlift in US history. They have done it with unmatched courage, professionalism, and resolve. Now, our 20-year military presence in Afghanistan has ended. My full statement:

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: I’m in Minnesota this afternoon where there are 260,000 or more lead service lines. My Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will replace 100% of them. We’re going to ensure every child in America can turn on the faucet and drink clean water.

tweetBy.description: 46th President of the United States, husband to @FLOTUS, proud dad & pop. Tweets may be archived: https://t.co/HDhBZBkKpU Text me: (302) 404-0880

fullText: Real change happens one person, one community, one connection at a time. If you’re an emerging leader in Chicago, Detroit, or Jackson — I hope you’ll check out this new initiative to bring people from different backgrounds together to help solve local problems.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: I’m excited to announce that 105 inspiring young people from across Africa, Asia-Pacific, and Europe will be joining the @ObamaFoundation Leaders program. I am so proud of all of you, and I can't wait to see what you do.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: It's a reminder that, while the pace of change can often be slow, a small group of people can still help us take a giant leap forward – but only if we vote.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: This week, the Biden-Harris administration announced a major step forward in the fight for affordable health care. Starting in 2026, folks on Medicare will pay less for 10 essential medications—with more to come—all thanks to the Inflation Reduction Act.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: I'm proud of the progress that @DemRedistrict has made in the fight for fair maps. Their work is protecting our democracy, and ensuring that maps are drawn in a way that allows voters to select their representatives, not the other way around.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: Poll workers help keep our democracy alive by making sure elections run smoothly and voters can safely exercise their right to vote. This Poll Worker Recruitment Day, sign up to become a poll worker in your community at

fullText: On Veterans Day, we honor all the brave men and women who have served our country in uniform. You deserve our thanks and support.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: I want to congratulate Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson on her nomination to the Supreme Court. Judge Jackson has already inspired young Black women like my daughters to set their sights higher, and her confirmation will help them believe they can be anything they want to be.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: Last night, Russia launched a brazen attack on the people of Ukraine, in violation of international law and basic principles of human decency. Here’s my statement on what it means, and what should happen next.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: To date, My Brother’s Keeper has touched thousands of lives, and these are just a few stories of the inspiring young men we’ve met. By joining the @MBK_Alliance, you can help us reach even more.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: This Memorial Day, let’s remember the men and women who sacrificed everything for the people they served with and the country they loved. We owe them all an enormous debt of gratitude.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: At today’s @MBK_Alliance Leadership Forum, we’re talking about the amazing levels of activism we’ve seen since George Floyd was killed—and the need to reimagine policing and public safety. Join us live.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: The COVID-19 vaccines are a miracle of modern science, and getting one is the best way to protect yourself and your family. If you haven’t already, schedule an appointment near you at

fullText: Michelle and I are thinking of everyone affected by Hurricane Ida, and we're grateful to the first responders doing heroic work. Here are some ways to support those in need:

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: Our hearts go out to the families who lost a loved one, and to everyone continuing the mission in Kabul. We’re also thinking of the families of the Afghans who died, many of whom stood by America and were willing to risk everything for a chance at a better life.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: As president, nothing was more painful than grieving with the loved ones of Americans who gave their lives serving our country. As President Biden said, these service members are heroes who have been engaged in a dangerous, selfless mission to save the lives of others.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: Like so many of you, Michelle and I were heartbroken to hear about the terrorist attack outside the Kabul airport that killed and wounded so many U.S. service members, as well as Afghan men, women, and children.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: America needs you as states prepare for the next round of redistricting. It's up to all of us to make sure we have a fair democracy. Join me in the fight for fair maps. Join me and @allontheline today:

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: Happy birthday to one of my heroes — someone who believed our right to vote was more important than his own life. Thanks for making good trouble for 80 years, @repjohnlewis.

fullText: My statement on the death of George Floyd:

fullText: If you believe in a more just, more generous, more democratic America, now is the time to fight for it. Here’s a terrific way to register voters, organize communities, and ramp up turnout in the battleground states that will decide this election:

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: Chadwick came to the White House to work with kids when he was playing Jackie Robinson. You could tell right away that he was blessed. To be young, gifted, and Black; to use that power to give them heroes to look up to; to do it all while in pain – what a use of his years.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: I commend the players on the @Bucks for standing up for what they believe in, coaches like @DocRivers, and the @NBA and @WNBA for setting an example. It’s going to take all our institutions to stand up for our values.

tweetBy.description: Dad, husband, President, citizen.

fullText: Don’t let them convince you that your vote doesn’t matter. Make a plan to vote and register at  Vote early if you can. Tell everyone you know to do the same.

fullText: The balance of power in the Senate is at stake in Georgia’s runoff election. We’ve got two great candidates—@ReverendWarnock and @Ossoff—who need your support. Go to  to find ways to get involved.

fullText: No, you should never allow yourself to grow comfortable with the fact that the 400 richest families in this country pay a lower tax rate than most working families.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Here's the crazy situation. Somebody making $10 million in a year is contributing the EXACT SAME AMOUNT into Social Security as somebody making $160,000. Let's raise the cap and expand Social Security benefits, not cut them.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: As everybody knows, we are dealing with a national mental health crisis. What I've heard from workers across the country is that coming together and fighting for higher wages and better benefits has helped them combat the isolation that so many of us are feeling.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: In the coming days, decisions will be made with respect to our federal budget that could impact the lives of Americans for a decade. The debate we are having is about our national priorities. It is about what we value as a nation and whose side we are on.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: While Republicans say they are "deeply concerned" about the national debt, they support:. -$1.8 trillion tax break for handful of multi-billionaires.-$3.5 trillion extension of Trump's tax breaks.-Massive increase in $858B Pentagon budget. This hypocrisy is truly breathtaking.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: We are standing up against a ruling class that is driven by an unprecedented level of corporate greed from CEOs who are often dishonest, irresponsible, arrogant, and could care less about the average worker. We need an unprecedented worker response.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: INTERNATIONAL SOLIDARITY: I’m LIVE at @uniglobalunion Congress in Philadelphia to stand with unions from around the world as they join forces to take on corporate greed.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Yesterday, I gave a major speech about why Democrats must ignore the corporate wing of the party and instead put forward a concrete agenda that speaks to the needs of struggling working Americans. You can READ my full remarks here:

fullText: LIVE: Join us NOW for a rally in Rhode Island to support @AaronRegunberg’s grassroots campaign for Congress.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Change is coming. The question is: What kind of change will it be? Will it be a Trump authoritarian change which divides us up based on the color of our skin or where we were born. Or one that brings us together to achieve economic & social justice and a world of human decency.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Let me congratulate the UAW for its new organizing campaign to unionize 150,000 US workers at non-union auto plants owned by companies like Tesla, Nissan, Toyota and BMW. We cannot expand and strengthen the middle class without a vibrant, strong and growing trade union movement.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: No, you should never allow yourself to grow comfortable with the fact that the 400 richest families in this country pay a lower tax rate than most working families.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Here's the crazy situation. Somebody making $10 million in a year is contributing the EXACT SAME AMOUNT into Social Security as somebody making $160,000. Let's raise the cap and expand Social Security benefits, not cut them.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: I believe in the "radical" notion that we should aspire to no longer be a nation with a for-profit health care system which fails so abysmally that it leaves hundreds of thousands of people who have to beg for money on GoFundMe to cover their medical bills.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: How is it that YouTube Music rakes in $6 BILLION in revenue in a given year, but pays its workers so poorly that they can't afford gas for their cars or a roof over their heads? It's GREED. I stand in strong solidarity alongside @GregCasar with striking YouTube Music Workers.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: I'm going to tell you something you won't hear about too much in the mainstream media. We have a corrupt political system in which billionaires through super PACs can buy elections in this country.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: As everybody knows, we are dealing with a national mental health crisis. What I've heard from workers across the country is that coming together and fighting for higher wages and better benefits has helped them combat the isolation that so many of us are feeling.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: In the coming days, decisions will be made with respect to our federal budget that could impact the lives of Americans for a decade. The debate we are having is about our national priorities. It is about what we value as a nation and whose side we are on.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: We are standing up against a ruling class that is driven by an unprecedented level of corporate greed from CEOs who are often dishonest, irresponsible, arrogant, and could care less about the average worker. We need an unprecedented worker response.

fullText: Yesterday, I gave a major speech about why Democrats must ignore the corporate wing of the party and instead put forward a concrete agenda that speaks to the needs of struggling working Americans. You can READ my full remarks here:

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Change is coming. The question is: What kind of change will it be? Will it be a Trump authoritarian change which divides us up based on the color of our skin or where we were born. Or one that brings us together to achieve economic & social justice and a world of human decency.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: I stand in solidarity with the 1,300 workers at the Hershey's factory in Virginia who are voting to join a union after the company made a $1.47 billion profit last year. I say to Hershey's: Stop the union busting. Stop the intimidation. Treat your workers with dignity & respect.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: At a time when so many Americans are hurting and feel totally powerless, Starbucks workers are taking on corporate greed and winning. They are an inspiration to all of us.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Congratulations to the workers in Mesa, Arizona for overwhelmingly voting to form the 3rd union shop at Starbucks. The movement to unionize Starbucks is spreading like wildfire. When workers stand up and fight for their dignity, there is no stopping them.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Today, I stand in solidarity with the Ukrainian people against this war and with the Russian people who are demonstrating against their corrupt, reckless president who started it.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Let us all stand together in strong solidarity with over 1,000 UAW workers in Racine, Wisconsin and Burlington, Iowa who are on strike for better wages & benefits & standing up against greed at Case and New Holland – a company that makes billions in profits each and every year.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Americans are demanding REAL gun safety reform. Ban the sale and distribution of assault weapons. Prohibit high-capacity magazines. Expand background checks. End the gun show loophole. If we can’t get 60 votes in the Senate, then we must end the filibuster.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: On Memorial Day, we honor those who gave their lives in defense of our country, and the families who lost loved ones. We will never forget them or their sacrifices. In their memory, we must stand strong in defense of American democracy against those who seek to undermine it.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: It shouldn't matter what age you are. No one needs an AR-15 or any other assault weapon designed to massacre people. When we had an assault weapons ban from 1994-2004, mass shootings went down 43%. After it expired, mass shootings tripled. End the filibuster. Ban assault weapons.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: 1 out of 4 corporations in this country don't pay a nickel in taxes while 7 in 10 Americans are living paycheck to paycheck. Maybe, just maybe, it's time our government looked out for the needs of working people, not just corporations and the rich.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: All workers in this country are entitled to a decent standard of living. That is not a radical idea.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: I stand with @seiuhcpa nursing home workers who are ready to strike at two of the biggest chains in Pennsylvania. Owners must bargain in good faith and put taxpayer money toward resident care — not use those dollars to keep buying new facilities.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: 7 paid sick days for rail workers is not radical.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: You ready for a really radical idea? Firing a worker because they’re sick and can’t come to work. That’s radical. What’s not radical is guaranteeing 7 paid sick days to all rail workers in America. Let’s get it done.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: The corporate greed never ends. Last year, the rail industry made a record-breaking $20 billion in profits after cutting their workforce by 30% over the last 6 years. Meanwhile, rail workers have ZERO guaranteed paid sick days. Congress must stand with rail workers.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: On #BlackFriday, I stand in solidarity with Amazon workers who are on strikes & walkouts all over the world. If Amazon can afford to pay its CEO $214 million, if Jeff Bezos can afford a $500 million yacht, Amazon can afford to give workers decent raises & end its union busting.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Walmart, the largest employer in America, is owned by the richest family in America. Their wealth has gone up $50 billion during the pandemic, and they spend millions on themselves. But the company they own starts workers off at $11 an hour. That is outrageous.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: The relief bill is life and death for millions of working families. I’m LIVE with @PplsAction to talk about how we get it done.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Raising the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour would benefit 32 million workers and would give low-wage workers an extra $3,300 a year. I'll say that again. Raising the minimum wage to $15 an hour would benefit 32 MILLION workers. Let's get it done.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: The owners of Walmart, the Walton Family, are the richest family in the country. They're worth $200 billion. They currently pay at least HALF their workers less than $15 an hour. That is absurd. The richest family in America can afford to pay their workers a living wage.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Congratulations to Democrats in Texas for protecting democracy and the right to vote. Let's see if Democrats in the U.S. Senate have the same courage. We MUST pass S. 1, the For The People Act. The future of American democracy is at stake.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Poverty is not just doing without luxuries. It is a death sentence. At a time when income and wealth inequality is growing, the richest American men live 15 years longer than the poorest men, while the gap for women is 10 years. This is unacceptable.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: The American people want action, not never-ending "negotiations" and obstructionism, and they will not come out and vote for a party that does not deliver. If not now, when?.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Democracy in America means one person, one vote. It does not mean billionaires buying elections. It does not mean suppressing the vote. It does not mean rigging the next election because you lost the last one. People fought and died for our democracy — it is our job to defend it.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: The special interests right now are flooding Capitol Hill trying to defeat us. The drug companies are trying to defeat us. The fossil fuel industry is trying to defeat us. The billionaire class is trying to defeat us. If we stand together, and fight — we're going to win.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: We had over 2300 people join us Friday night in Indiana to discuss how our Budget Reconciliation Legislation will create millions of good-paying jobs and address issues in this country that have been ignored for far too long. Watch the discussion now:

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: The immense devastation caused in Louisiana and in Mississippi by Hurricane Ida will become our new normal unless we get our act together and take bold action to combat climate change NOW.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Thank you to the over 700 people who joined us in Cedar Rapids to discuss the need to boldly address the many crises facing working families today. If we stand together, we can not only solve the issues we face, but we can also move this country forward in the fight for justice.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: I'm proud to stand with @SBWorkersUnited in their fight for decent wages and decent working conditions. Starbucks is raking in record profits in 2021. They are not a struggling company. So why are they working so hard to defeat workers' efforts to form a union?.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Let's be honest about the stakes of this moment. The Republican Party today is an anti-democracy party. They are doing all they can to make it harder for American citizens to vote and participate in the political process. We cannot allow them to succeed.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Just this year alone, 33 laws that make it harder for Americans to vote have been enacted in.- AL.- AZ.- AR.- FL.- GA.- ID.- IN.- IA.- KS.- KY.- LA.- MT.- NV.- NH.- NY.- OK.- TX.- UT.- WY.Unacceptable. We must make it easier — not harder — to vote in this country.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: In 2021 so far, there have been more than 425 bills introduced in state legislatures in 49 states across the country aimed at making it harder to vote. Join me, Sen. @amyklobuchar, @ariberman, @nseufot, and @NicholsUprising this Wednesday at 8 PM ET to discuss how we fight back.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: No, you should not accept an economic system which allows the CEOs of this country to grow their pay by 1,167% while at the same time, worker pay has grown by just 13.7%. Another world and an economy which works for all of us is possible, but only if we fight for it.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: We need real police department reform. Every police officer involved in a killing must be held accountable, and those found guilty must be punished with the full force of the law. Every killing of a person held in police custody must be investigated by the Department of Justice.

fullText: George Floyd’s murder is not only an outrage. It is the latest manifestation of a system that callously devalues the lives of Black people. Our struggle is and always has been about justice—not justice on paper, but real justice in the real lives of real people.

fullText: What we need is a nation that fundamentally respects the human dignity of every person. That starts with justice for George Floyd.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Today, a worker must earn $23.96 an hour to afford a modest 2 bedroom apartment – $5.74 more than the average tenant makes. As a result, 18 million families are paying over 50% of their income on housing. We need to raise wages and build 10 million units of affordable housing.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: Despite an explosion in technology & a huge increase in productivity, the average U.S. worker is making $30 a week less today than she/he made 47 years ago after adjusting for inflation. Meanwhile, the top 1% has become $22 trillion richer since 1990. Yes. We need a wealth tax.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator for Vermont. Not me, us.

fullText: If Congress does not get its act together soon, up to 87 million workers will lose the paid sick and family leave they desperately need. We must expand these benefits to all workers. No worker should have to make the unacceptable choice of going to work sick or losing a paycheck.

fullText: Thomas Piketty is right. At a time when the very rich are becoming much richer while working families are facing economic devastation, we need to address the obscene level of income and wealth inequality. We need to tax the extreme wealth of multi-millionaires and billionaires.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator, former teacher. Wife, mom (Amelia, Alex, Bailey, @CFPB), grandmother, and Okie. She/her. Official campaign account.

fullText: We have to make real change in our country and fundamentally reform how the law is enforced in America. We need accountability for law enforcement and accountability at every stage of our criminal justice system.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator, former teacher. Wife, mom (Amelia, Alex, Bailey, @CFPB), grandmother, and Okie. She/her. Official campaign account.

fullText: The racist violence that killed George Floyd, Ahmaud Arbery, and Breonna Taylor is not new in America. And what's captured on video represents only a fraction of the violence that Black Americans experience, some of it while in police custody.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator, former teacher. Wife, mom (Amelia, Alex, Bailey, @CFPB), grandmother, and Okie. She/her. Official campaign account.

fullText: As we fight this global pandemic and economic recession, we can’t ignore the ever-growing threat of climate change. All three challenges have disproportionately affected Black and Brown communities. And we’re running out of time to act.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator, former teacher. Wife, mom (Amelia, Alex, Bailey, @CFPB), grandmother, and Okie. She/her. Official campaign account.

fullText: Don’t wake up on Wednesday, November 4th, wishing you’d done more to help Democrats win. Remind your friends to register to vote, sign up to volunteer for a local race in your community, stand up, and speak out every single day. Stay. In. The. Fight.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator, former teacher. Wife, mom (Amelia, Alex, Bailey, @CFPB), grandmother, and Okie. She/her. Official campaign account.

fullText: Millions out of work. Millions more trapped in cycles of poverty. Millions on the brink of losing their homes. Millions of restaurants and stores hanging by a thread. This crisis is bad—and didn’t have to be this way. This is on Donald Trump and the Republicans who enable him.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator, former teacher. Wife, mom (Amelia, Alex, Bailey, @CFPB), grandmother, and Okie. She/her. Official campaign account.

fullText: .@JulianCastro is exactly right: with so many families struggling to put food on the table, it is cruel for Republicans to continue blocking real relief for working people during this crisis.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator, former teacher. Wife, mom (Amelia, Alex, Bailey, @CFPB), grandmother, and Okie. She/her. Official campaign account.

fullText: People all over the country are supporting local institutions on #SmallBusinessSaturday—but Washington needs to have their backs, too. Small businesses need real relief so they can make it to the other side of this crisis.

tweetBy.description: U.S. Senator, former teacher. Wife, mom (Amelia, Alex, Bailey, @CFPB), grandmother, and Okie. She/her. Official campaign account.

fullText: Betty Boothroyd was a legendary speaker who governed the Commons with an elegant authority. She made history. I pay tribute to her and my thoughts are with her family.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: A year ago today, we woke up to the heartbreaking news of Putin's illegal invasion of Ukraine. The suffering and loss of life caused by Putin's war must be remembered forever, as should the bravery of the Ukranian people. We stand with them today and always. Slava Ukraini. 🇺🇦

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: Supporting Ukraine now is the best long-term investment we can make in global security. My piece with @LindseyGrahamSC in the WSJ:

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: Great to discuss the AUKUS partnership as part of this @hudsoninstitute panel. This trilateral defence partnership will preserve peace and security, and create jobs in the UK.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: Great news that Ukrainian forces have established themselves on the east bank of the Dnieper, and great to see our new Foreign Secretary in Kyiv.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: This is a powerful message from the international sporting community that we will not tolerate Putin's abhorrent assaults on freedom and liberty. Well done FIFA and UEFA.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: We have further isolated Russia from the international financial system this morning. Working with our partners, and the G7, we are determined to impose the most severe economic measures possible against President Putin for his abhorrent campaign against Ukraine. Putin must fail.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: Welcome news that BP is joining the rapidly growing list of organisations and governments isolating Russia over Putin's brutal and miscalculated invasion of Ukraine.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: Congratulations to the city of Bradford on becoming the UK’s City of Culture for 2025. This title builds on the rich history and dynamism of the city, bringing investment and opportunity for everyone who lives and works there.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: We have already recruited 13,790 police officers who are giving us the firepower needed to fight crime, put more dangerous offenders behind bars and make our streets safer.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: I'm saddened to hear of the death of Gorbachev. I always admired the courage & integrity he showed in bringing the Cold War to a peaceful conclusion. In a time of Putin’s aggression in Ukraine, his tireless commitment to opening up Soviet society remains an example to us all.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: I'm proud that since I took office in July 2019, we have increased coverage of gigabit broadband from 7% of households to 70%.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: 20 million people across the UK have now got the jab – a huge national achievement and a testament to the tireless work of NHS staff, volunteers, the Armed Forces & many more. I urge everyone to get the jab when called. Every jab makes a difference in our battle against COVID.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: Today Kuwait marks 30 years since its liberation from occupation. We remember those who gave their lives fighting bravely for freedom, including many British service personnel. I send my best wishes to our Kuwaiti friends as they celebrate their 60th National Day 🇰🇼🇬🇧.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: This is very welcome news and another boost to our hugely successful vaccination programme. As we encourage everyone to get their jabs, the single-dose Janssen vaccine will play an important role in helping us protect people from the virus. When you get the call, get the jab.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: The NHS has been tireless in its heroic work throughout the pandemic. I saw some of that brilliant work today at Colchester Hospital. We will continue to give the NHS the support it needs as we build back better.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: Sports and exercise are vital for the nation’s physical and mental health. We are doing everything we can to get @parkrunUK to return as soon as possible.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: Tonight’s UN Security Council resolution, led by the UK with our allies, makes clear that the international community stands with Afghans. There can be no return to repression or terror. We will push as one voice for safe passage, humanitarian access & respect for human rights.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: On the end of military operations in Afghanistan.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: Operation PITTING is a mission unlike anything we have seen in our lifetime, helping 15,000 people to safety in just under two weeks. I want to thank everyone involved and the thousands of those who served over the last two decades. You can be proud of what you have achieved.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: Staff and volunteers at vaccination centres are doing an amazing job – getting over 100 million jabs in arms across the UK. Vaccines are our best line of defence and we will offer all adults a booster by the end of January. Come forward and get yours as soon as you are called.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: It's time for another Great British vaccination effort. We've done it before and we are going to do it again. Let's not give this virus a second chance. #GetBoosted

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

fullText: We're introducing Tony's Law, increasing the maximum penalties for anyone who causes or allows the death or serious physical harm of a child – so that the punishment fits the crime.

tweetBy.description: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
